data.question: What is the highest CO2 uptake capacity reported among the CPM-200 series MOFs at 273 K and 1 bar?
Which metal combinations in the CPM-200 series were found to be unprecedented in crystalline porous materials prior to this study?
True or False: The CO2 uptake performance of CPM-200-Fe/Mg at 298 K and 1 bar is higher than that of HKUST-1.
What is the role of InCl3 in the synthesis of heterometallic CPM-200 MOFs?
data.answer: InCl3 is irreplaceable for the formation of heterometallic CPM-200 MOFs, but pure InCl3 cannot lead to the formation of CPM-200-In.

data.question: True or False: The isosteric heat of adsorption for CO2 in CPM-200-V/Mg is lower than that of Cu-BTTri-mmen.
What is the significance of the charge-to-radius ratio (z/r) in the context of CPM-200 MOFs?
data.answer: A strong correlation between z/r and the isosteric heat for CO2 was observed for the first time in MOFs, indicating its importance in understanding gas sorption properties.

data.question: True or False: All CPM-200 MOFs exhibit the same framework topology.
What experimental conditions were crucial for achieving cocrystallization of chemically dissimilar metals in the synthesis of CPM-200 MOFs?
data.answer: The mass ratio of DMA and water near to 5:1 and the use of InCl3 were crucial for achieving cocrystallization.

data.question: True or False: The gas sorption performance of CPM-200 MOFs is solely determined by the type of metal ions used.
How does the introduction of Mg2+ ions affect the CO2 uptake performance in CPM-200 MOFs?
data.answer: The introduction of Mg2+ ions dramatically tunes the CO2 uptake performance, with an increase in CO2 uptake observed for CPM-200 with increasing Mg/In ratios.

data.question: True or False: The cooperative crystallization strategy was essential for the formation of CPM-200 MOFs.
What is the effect of the synergy during crystallization on the formation of CPM-200 MOFs?
data.answer: The synergy during crystallization is so essential that corresponding homometallic MOFs could not be made under the same conditions in the absence of any one of two metal sources.

data.question: True or False: The CO2 uptake values of CPM-200 MOFs at 273 K and 1 bar are all above 200 cm3/g.
What factors contribute to the CO2 adsorption performance of CPM-200 MOFs?
data.answer: The CO2 adsorption performance may be attributed to the interactions between CO2 and open metal sites, influenced by molecular mass and the charge-to-radius ratio of metal ions.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of CPM-200 MOFs was successful under any DMA/water ratio.
What is the highest isosteric heat of adsorption for CO2 reported among the CPM-200 series MOFs?
True or False: The CO2 uptake performance of CPM-200 MOFs at 298 K and 1 bar is uniformly higher than that of all other known MOFs.
How does the presence of heterometals in CPM-200 MOFs affect their gas sorption properties?
data.answer: The presence of heterometals bestows CPM-200 MOFs with the highest CO2 uptake capacity among known heterometallic MOFs and allows for fine and dramatic tuning of their properties.

data.question: True or False: The CO2/N2 selectivity of CPM-200 MOFs is solely determined by the framework topology.
What experimental technique was used to confirm the phase purity of all bulk samples of CPM-200 MOFs?
data.answer: The phase purity of all bulk samples was confirmed by powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD).
